name: Recursion Inferno! v1.3
description:
Knight is very similar to Femme Fatale, but since you can have both, I say: why not? Knight, Femme Fatale and Atman, can all benefit greatly from Scavenge. Same Old Thing is basically there just for Scavenge.

I picked Deep Red not so much for the memory, but because it allows to use Knight way more efficiently. Since I picked Magnum Opus as the main economy engine, I actually added a couple Akamatsu to allow some flexibility.

Test Run and Self-modifying Code for faster setup of the Icebreakers, and Clone Chip for some extra recycle on-the-fly.

Since I ended up playtesting against Jinteki and Weyland only, I removed the HQ focusing cards in favor of the usual R&D Interface. I also swapped Plascrete Carapace with Public Sympathy which works nicely with Professional Contacts and can protect from any kind of damage. Three copies for faster draw, and because the incoming Punitive Counterstrike will definitely raise the threat.

Lastly, I have 3 unspent influence points. I don't think I really need to spend them, also because I wouldn't know what to substitute, but... any suggestions?

The deck does work exceptionally well. Between Femme and Knight there's not much the Corp can do to keep you out. Also, Femme bypasses the restriction posed by Unorthodox Predictions and works perfectly on Hadrian's Wall and Ice Wall, the only two pieces of ICE that could (easily) make Knight noneffective. Janus 1.0 and Wotan are much rarer, but Femme can take care of them too.

name: Silhouette Lightning Attack
description:
Run like there is no tomorrow, pound HQ and Centrals, hope to win before it's too late...

Do NOT run the server he scores his agendas, do NOT expose - rez ice on this server, if you score a one pointer Frame them and blackmail them hitting their scoring remote.

I don't think it will work very good, but it is a fun archetype

name: Boby F. Self exiled
description:
The idea is to set up a recurring Pawn - Scheherezade - Deep Red economic drawing engine, hosting the bishops on ice as well.

Torch, Femme are to be installed by Test run/SMC - Scavenge, Battering Ram or Snowball completing the suite

Draw like crazy, run the easy servers for economy, reshuffle your stack-heap and repeat.

name: Spanish Inquisition v3
description:
Third revision of this deck.

I dropped FAOs and underperforming Gorman for 3rd Account Siphon and 3xCrescentus. It turns out that with knights you don't really need FAO. Just facecheck with no rig and when you actually have something to lose, pop a knight before facechecking. Crescentus is a star here, allows to run hq/rnd multiple times in one turn, as the corp can't afford to rez the same (possibly even rooked) ice over and over.

Gameplan:

  • keep the corp low on cash (reina, xanadu, rooks, siphons)
  • when they pay big time to rez, derez it with crescentus
  • dig through the rnd with medium and imps
  • trash high cost assets with imps
  • go tagme with siphons mid to late game (with plascretes/imps to help mitigate)
  • conjure nerve agent when least expected
  • use knights to breach remotes by surprise
  • deja vu use depends on situation - bring back either siphon, both imps or something important lost to damage

If you don't have any econ card in starting hand (siphons don't count), mulligan. There are very rare times when you want to mull even with econ - example: sure gamble, deja vu, plascrete, plascrete, nerve agent. I have much fun playing this deck. Comments appreciated!

In comments to the previous revision PeekaySK suggested using Compromised Employees. I was really pumped to try this out as I thought it goes well with costly rezzing theme. It didn't work out at all. Reina discourages rezzing, but you get most out of your Compromised Employee when there is lots of rezzing. Crescentus was clearly a superior choice here.

name: Everything is a Nail Mk. 2
description: When programs are your hammer everything looks like a nail.

name: Quick ICE Mk. 2
description: Get to the mid game, and stay there.

name: Great Wall Of Weyland
description: My version of the "great wall of Weyland" deck.

name: Click Inversion
description: casual HB teaching deck that I play when introducing new players to cover most of the game elements.

name: Untrashable v3
description:
This deck is built on the idea that running any single remote against Jinteki:RP is going to be more expensive, and then makes your assets and upgrades even more costly to trash with Encryption Protocols.

Eventually you want a good pile of money plus Ash + Hokusai Combo with some Encryption Protocols on the side. Effectively you would force the runner to have to waste 3 clicks, take 2 damage and spend a good pile of credits just to take a look at a remote once. Then you recur your Ash with Howards or Interns.

Sundew is the star of this deck. Protect it early with a Chimera or leave it unprotected if the runner does not trash assets and it can proivide a truckload of money over the course of the game.

Server Diagnostics also works fairly well in this deck as you can play it after you've protected your centrals and it will act like another Sundew. Just make sure you don't fall into the tempation and wait too long to install ICE if they are running. After 3 turns they've made their cost at least so if you need ICE and not money, play them.

Closed Accounts might seem like a weird card in this deck, but it has caught a lot of players unaware, especially if they gathered a few tags from shadows before this hit the table. However it's there primarily for counter to tag-me/siphon runners, because otherwise they will walk all over you.

  • This deck in action
